overview: Artists Maxime Berthou and Mark Po≈ælep embarked on a practice-based research journey on the Mississippi River from September 2 to October 20, 2019. Their means of transportation was a hand-built 20-foot (6-meter) steam-powered paddle boat named "Thumpa." Their goal was to research and experience contemporary American life along this mythical river. Following the methodology and chronology of a research-action project,
tagline: 1712 Miles, 42 Varieties of Corn, 10 States, One Moonshine
title: Southwind
